de.systemagmbh.interfaces.logger
Interface ISysLog

All Known Subinterfaces:
ISysLogger, ISysLoggerManager
All Known Implementing Classes:
ASysLogger, DummyISysLog, DummyISysLogger, DummyISysLoggerManager, NirvanaLog
public interface ISysLog

The interface ISysLog has only the 'log' method. All classes that implement ISysLog can be registered at CSysLog. The log method of ISysLog is called by CSysLog then.

Version:
$Revision: 1.5 $
Author:
Udo Friedrich

Method Summary
 void log(String componentType, Object toBeLogged, int level, Properties additionals)
          This defines a method for logging that must be supported to be registered at CSysLog.
 

Method Detail

log

public void log(String componentType,
                Object toBeLogged,
                int level,
                Properties additionals)
This defines a method for logging that must be supported to be registered at CSysLog. The Systema Components are using CSysLog for logging.

Parameters:
componentType - The name of the application part that called the log method.
This is used for the component log levels!
(May be empty if the concret implementation does not need this information.)
toBeLogged - The object that has to be logged.
level - The level that is used for logging the given text.
(May be empty if the concret implementation does not need this information.)
additionals - Additional parameters for checking and/or formatting this log entry.
(May be empty if the concret implementation does not support additional information.)
